tit.e: Kyooyaku (a person in charge of the entertainment)

Kyooyaku (a person in charge of the entertainment)

sen.j: 饗応役(きょうおうやく)とは、江戸時代、天皇・太上天皇・皇后より派遣されて江戸に下向してきた使者(それぞれ勅使・院使・女院使)を接待するために江戸幕府が設けた役職である。
sen.e: Kyooyaku is the post, which was established by Edo bakufu, in order to entertain envoys (Imperial envoy, Inshi (a messenger from the retired Emperor), envoy of the empress) who were dispatched to Edo by the Emperor, Daijo tenno' (the Retired Emperor) and the Empress in Edo Period.

Kyooyaku' is a post established by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to entertain messengers of the Emperor, the Retired Emperor or the Empress (called "chokushi," "inshi" and "nyoinshi" respectively) sent to Edo in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 全文修正しました。
sen.e: The Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) established the post of 'Kyooyaku' during the Edo period to have someone provide entertainment for messengers of the emperor (who were known as "chokushi"), messengers of the retired emperor (who were known as "inshi"), or messengers of the empress (who were known as "nyoinshi") that had been sent to Edo.
sen.cmt: the Emperor, the Retired Emperor or the Empress→the emperor, the retired emperor or the empress(特定の天皇等を指さないので小文字にしました）

sen.j: 主に外様大名が任命された。
sen.e: Mostly, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) was appointed as kyooyaku.
Mostly, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) was appointed as kyooyaku.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Mostly, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) was appointed as kyooyaku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 御馳走役・接待役・館伴役ともいう。
sen.e: Kyooyaku was also called "gochisoyaku", "settutaiyaku" and 館伴役.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明
sen.e: Kyooyaku was also called "gochisoyaku", "settaiyaku"or "kanbanyaku."
sen.cmt: "settutaiyaku" and 館伴役 を"settaiyaku" or "kanbanyaku" に修正しました。
sen.e: Kyooyaku was also called "gochisoyaku", "settaiyaku"or "kanbanyaku."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 忠臣蔵で有名な浅野内匠頭は吉良上野介への刃傷の際に勅使饗応役を務めていたことで知られる。
sen.e: It is known that Takuminokami ASANO, who was famous for Chushingura (The treasury of Loyal Retainers), served as kyooyaku for the Imperial envoy when he had a sword fight with Kozukenosuke KIRA..

It is known that ASANO Takumi no Kami, who was famous for Chushingura (The treasury of Loyal Retainers), served as kyooyaku for the imperial messenger when he had a sword fight with KIRA Kozuke no Suke.
sen.cmt: Takuminokami ASANO をASANO Takumi no Kami に修正しました。Imperial envoy を imperial messengerKozukenosuke KIRA をKIRA Kozuke no Suke に修正しました。
sen.e: It is known that ASANO Takumi no Kami, who was famous for Chushingura (The treasury of Loyal Retainers), served as kyooyaku for the imperial messenger when he had a sword fight with KIRA Kozuke no Suke.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 毎年正月には幕府征夷大将軍は、高家という旗本たちを派遣して京都の天皇と上皇に対して年賀を奏上する。
sen.e: On every New Year's Day, Seii Taishogun of the Edo bakufu dispatched hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) called koke (privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate) to Kyoto to make New Year's greetings to the Emperor and the retired Emperor.

On every New Year's Day, Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu dispatched hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) called koke (privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate) to Kyoto to make New Year's greetings to the Emperor and the Retired Emperor.
sen.cmt: Seii Taishogun に (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") を追記しました。which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun 既出のため削除しました。retired Emperor を Retired Emperor に修正しました。
sen.e: On every New Year's Day, Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu dispatched hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) called koke (privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate) to Kyoto to make New Year's greetings to the emperor and the retired emperor.
sen.cmt: the Emperor and the Retired Emperor→the emperor and the retired emperor

sen.j: これに対して天皇と上皇は、答礼として2月下旬から3月半ばにかけて勅使(天皇の使者)と院使(上皇の使者)を江戸へ派遣する。
sen.e: In response, the Emperor and the retired Emperor dispatched Imperial envoy (envoy for the Emperor) and Inshi (a messenger from the retired Emperor) to Edo for a return visit from the end of February to mid-March.
In response, the Emperor and the Retired Emperor dispatched their messengers to Edo for a return visit from the end of February to mid-March.
sen.cmt: Imperial envoy and Inshi (a messenger from the retired Emperor) を their messengers に修正しました。
sen.e: In response, the emperor and the retired emperor dispatched their messengers to Edo for a return visit from the end of February to mid-March.
sen.cmt: the Emperor and the Retired Emperor →the emperor and the retired emperor

sen.j: これが江戸時代の毎年の恒例行事であった。
sen.e: This was an annual event in Edo period.
This was an annual event in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Edo period に定冠詞を追記しました。
sen.e: This was an annual event in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸へ下向した勅使と院使は江戸にいる間は幕府の伝奏屋敷に滞在するのだが、ここで御馳走をふるまったり、高価な進物を献上したり、勅使院使の行く先のインテリアを良くしたり、お話し相手になったりするのが饗応役である。
sen.e: The Imperial envoy and inshi who visited Edo stayed at the residence for imperial envoys during their stay in Edo, and on this occation, people who entertained them, sent the expensive sinmotsu (gift) to them, improved the interior they visited and kept their company were Kyooyaku.

Messengers of the Emperor or the Retired Emperor who visited Edo stayed at the bakufu's special residence for imperial messengers, and on this occasion, it was Kyooyaku who entertained them, sent expensive gifts to them, improved the interior of the places where they visited and kept their company.
sen.cmt: 全文修正しました。※「勅使」と「院使」はそれぞれ異なる役割を担う使者であるため、ここでは'or' を使用しています。
sen.e: Messengers of the emperor or the retired emperor who visited Edo stayed at the bakufu's special residence for imperial messengers, where Kyooyaku entertained them, presented expensive gifts to them, improved the interior of the places where they visited and kept their company.
sen.cmt: the Emperor or the Retired Emperor→the emperor or the retired emperor, and on this occasion, it was →where sent expensive gifts→presented expensive gifts to them(その場で渡すので）

sen.j: 勅使饗応役に就任するのは、4万石から7万石前後の所領を持つ城主の外様大名、院使饗応役に就任するのは1万石から3万石前後の陣屋の外様大名であることが多かった。
sen.e: In many cases, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) who was a lord of a castle with territory of forty thousands to seventy thousands Goku crop yields became Kyooyaku for Imperial envoy, while tozama daimyo of jinya (regional government office) with territory of ten thousands to thirty thousands Goku crop yields became Kyooyaku for inshi.

In many cases, tozama daimyo who was a lord of a castle with territory of forty thousands to seventy thousands Goku crop yields became Kyooyaku for messengers of the Emperor, while tozama daimyo of jinya (regional government office) with territory of ten thousands to thirty thousands Goku crop yields became Kyooyaku for those of the Retired Emperor.
sen.cmt: (nonhereditary feudal lord) 既出のため削除しました。Imperial envoy を messengers of the Emperor に、inshi を those of the Retired Emperor に、それぞれ修正しました。
sen.e: In many cases, tozama daimyo who was a lord of a castle with territory of 40,000 to 70,000 koku became Kyooyaku for messengers of the emperor, while tozama daimyo of jinya (regional government office) with territory of 10,000 to 30,000 koku became Kyooyaku for those of the retired emperor.
sen.cmt: forty thousands to seventy thousands Goku crop yields→40,000 to 70,000 koku (統一リストにあわせました）Emperor→emperorten thousands to thirty thousands Goku crop yields →10,000 to 30,000 kokuRetired Emperor→retired emperor

sen.j: 勅使と院使の饗応には莫大な予算がかかることから、幕府は余計な蓄財をさせない意味で外様大名ばかりを任命した。
sen.e: As Kyoo (banquet) for Imperial envoy and inshi cost huge amount of money, Edo bakufu appointed only tozama daimyo as Kyooyaku for preventing them from saving extra money.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As entertaining the messengers of the Emperor or the Retired Emperor costs huge amount of money, the Edo bakufu appointed only tozama daimyo as Kyooyaku for preventing them from saving extra money.
sen.cmt: Kyoo (banquet) for Imperial envoy and Inshi を entertaining the messengers of the Emperor or the Retired Emperor に修正しました。cost を costs に修正しました。Edo bakufu に定冠詞を追記しました。
sen.e: As entertaining the messengers of the emperor or the retired emperor cost a huge amount of money, the Edo bakufu appointed only tozama daimyo as Kyooyaku to prevent them from saving extra money.
sen.cmt: the Emperor or the Retired Emperor→the emperor or the retired emperor

sen.j: だが、武骨な大名が一人でつとめて天皇や上皇の使者に対して無礼があったりしてもいけないので、饗応役の大名には朝廷への礼儀作法に通じた高家肝煎が指南役(口添え役とも)につくのが決まりであった。
sen.e: However, there was a rule that Koke-kimoiri (performing good offices for nobles) served as the instructor (or adviser) of kyooyaku for daimyo, who were familiar with civility and rules of etiquette toward the Imperial Court for preventing boorish daimyo from serving as envoy only by himself and behaving in an impolite manner toward the Emperor and the retired Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there was a rule that Koke-kimoiri (performing good offices for nobles) served as the instructor (or adviser) of kyooyaku for daimyo, who were familiar with civility and rules of etiquette toward the Imperial Court for preventing boorish daimyo from serving only by himself and behaving in an impolite manner toward the messengers of the Emperor or the Retired Emperor.
sen.cmt: retired Emperor を Retired Emperor に修正しました。from serving as envoy only by himself and behaving in an impolite manner toward the Emperor and the retired Emperor をfrom serving only by himself and behaving in an impolite manner toward the messengers of the Emperor or the Retired Emperor に修正しました。
sen.e: However, to prevent boorish daimyo, who served in the position alone, from behaving in an impolite manner toward messengers of the emperor or the retired emperor, there was a rule that Koke-kimoiri (a kind of mentor for nobles who was familiar with manners and rules of etiquette that had to be observed for members of the Imperial Court) served as an instructor (or an adviser) for Kyooyaku daimyo.
sen.cmt: serving only by himselfをpreventするのではなく、「一人でつとめることで無礼があってはならない」ということなので変更しました。kyooyaku →Kyooyaku（他のに合わせました）the→an

sen.j: 饗応役の大名はこの高家に対しても指南料として高価な進物を贈らねばならなかった。
sen.e: Daimyo of Kyooyaku also had to send the expensive gift to koke (privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate) as instruction fee.
Daimyo of Kyooyaku also had to send expensive gifts to koke as instruction fees.
sen.cmt: the expensive gift を expensive gifts に修正しました。(privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate) 既出のため削除しました。fee を fees に修正しました。
sen.e: Kyooyaku daimyo also had to give expensive gifts to koke as instruction fees.
sen.cmt: wording

sen.j: こうした勅使が下向・大名が饗応という一連の慣例が確立したのは｢徳川実紀｣で見たところ寛永9年(1632年)の時のようである。
sen.e: According to "Tokugawa Jikki (collection of official records of the Edo bakufu)", it was 1632 when a series of custom (imperial envoy left the capital and daimyo entertain them) was established.

According to "Tokugawa Jikki" (collection of official records of the Edo bakufu), it was 1632 when a series of custom (imperial messengers leave the capital and daimyo entertain them) was established.
sen.cmt: "Tokugawa Jikki (collection of official records of the Edo bakufu)" を"Tokugawa Jikki" (collection of official records of the Edo bakufu) に修正しました。imperial envoy left を imperial messengers leaveに修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Tokugawa Jikki" (collection of official records of the Edo bakufu), it was 1632 when a series of custom (imperial messengers leave the capital and daimyo entertain them) was established.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またこの行事以外にも必要に応じて勅使や院使が江戸や日光へ送られることがあるので、そのたび饗応役は選任された。
sen.e: And except this event, as Imperial envoy or Inshi were sometimes sent to Edo when needed, Kyooyaku was selected each time.
And except this event, as messengers of the Emperor or Retired Emperor were sent to Edo and/or Nikko when needed, Kyooyaku was selected each time.
sen.cmt: 「日光へ」訳漏れのためand/or Nikko を追記しました。as Imperial envoy or Inshi were sometimes sent to Edo をas messengers of the Emperor or Retired Emperor were sent to Edo and/or Nikko に修正しました。
sen.e: And except this event, as messengers of the emperor or the retired emperor were sent to Edo and/or Nikko when needed, Kyooyaku was selected each time.
sen.cmt: the Emperor or Retired Emperor→the emperor or the retired emperor
